com.google.wave.api
Class OperationQueue

java.lang.Object
  com.google.wave.api.OperationQueue

public class OperationQueue
extends java.lang.Object

A utility class that abstracts the queuing of operations, represented by OperationRequest, using easily callable functions. The OperationQueue queues the resulting operations in order. Typically there shouldn't be a need to call this directly unless operations are needed on entities outside of the scope of the robot. For example, to modify a blip that does not exist in the current context, you might specify the wave, wavelet, and blip id to generate an operation. Any calls to this will not be reflected in the robot in any way. For example, calling wavelet_append_blip will not result in a new blip being added to the robot current context, only an operation to be sent to the robot proxy.

Returns:

getProxyForId

public java.lang.String getProxyForId()
Returns the id for proxyingFor parameter.

Returns:
the proxying id.

proxyFor

public OperationQueue proxyFor(java.lang.String proxyForId)
Creates a view of this OperationQueue with the proxying for set to the given id. This method returns a new instance of an operation queue that shares the operation list, but has a different proxyForId set so when the robot uses this new queue, subsequent operations will be sent out with the proxying_for field set.

Parameters:
proxyForId - the proxying information.
Returns:
a view of this OperationQueue with the proxying information set.

clear

public void clear()
Clears this operation queue.

modifyTagOfWavelet

public void modifyTagOfWavelet(Wavelet wavelet,
                               java.lang.String tag,
                               java.lang.String modifyHow)
Modifies a tag in a wavelet.

Parameters:
wavelet - the wavelet to modify the tag from.
tag - the name of the tag to be modified
modifyHow - how to modify the tag. The default behavior is to add the tag. Specify remove to remove, or specify null or add to add.

modifyDocument

public OperationRequest modifyDocument(Blip blip)
Creates and queues a document modify operation.

Parameters:
blip - the blip to modify.
Returns:
an instance of OperationRequest that represents this operation. The caller of this method should append the required and/or optional parameters, such as:
  • modifyAction
  • modifyQuery
  • index
  • range
